blog.name: ladyspartacus
blog.title: Untitled
blog.description: I have many fandoms and many ships and have an ongoing love affair with villains and darker MCs

body:
Lady Stoneheart and Arya Theory???

So I know a lot of people seem to think that Arya will end up in the Riverlands again so she can claim her pack (Nymeria & her little grey cousins) and so she can kill Lady Stoneheart, but I disagree. I don’t think Arya will end Lady Stoneheart, at least not in the Riverlands and not just after returning to Westeros. In fact, I don’t think she will run into the BWB while in the Riverlands. I think Arya will reclaim her relationship with Nymeria and possibly see some other old faces, but not the ones you would expect.

As for Lady Stoneheart, she will most likely make her way up North. Either because of the rumors about Arya, Stannis being up there in Winterfell & being a kin slayer(Undead!Cat is killing peeps she considers ‘no bueno’), Jon having gotten some sort of position of power in Winterfell (Catelyn wouldn’t be happy about that), cause she heard of Sansa being alive, or cause Thoros will convince her to head that way similar to the show (unlikely but a possibility). The Arya, Stannis, and Jon reasons are the most likely, in my opinion. I think she’ll already be headed North by the time Sansa heads there too. Plus, I don’t trust anything the show has to say so the Thoros one is less likely to me.

And while she’s up North, I think she’s going to have a very important role to play, which is the main reason I don’t think she will die in the Riverlands. What I mean pertains to the way she was brought back to life, the very literal 'Kiss of Life’. As far as we know being brought back isn’t something that widespread amongst the followers of the faith of the Lord of Light. If it was, more people would be converted and using it to try and bring their dead back. Furthermore, if Stoneheart was just meant to be a foil for the Frey’s & Brienne/ a stepping stone for Arya, then why give her such a unique way of being brought back? I’ll tell you why! It’s cause George is planning on using it later on. George has even stated that he thinks one of the double douches’ biggest mistakes is not bringing in Stoneheart (ie~ she’s vital to the story). Why say that if she’s just going to be killed by Arya??? No, she’s going to use the kiss to bring back someone else, who may or may not use it on someone else in return [possibly jon being brought back for a second time or the first( I only think this one because of how long cat had been dead when she was brought back vs beric & jon is at the wall where he won’t decompose any time soon) and then jon using this to bring back another maybe🤔(I have thoughts about this but I won’t get into that right now)]. Either way, George isn’t the type to introduce such a big game changer and then not use it.

Then there’s the whole Brienne plotline, which is currently tied to Stoneheart and the BWB the last time we read anything about them. Brienne is likely going to pass on some kind of info relevant to Stoneheart &/or be given a second chance with a new mission of sorts. I even think there’s a possibility of Brienne being brought back to life herself as an undead (I know how crackpotty this one is but wouldn’t it be cool 😉).

Anyways, I just think there’s too much that can be done with Stoneheart for her to die so simply at the hands of Arya so she may have some closure with her mother. If you ask me, Jon could do with a “talk” with Catelyn as well. In fact, all the remaining Stark children could.

Now, I’m not saying that it’s impossible that Arya will kill her mom in the Riverlands, I just don’t think it’s the most plausible outcome. Either way, we’ll just have to wait till TWOW is released to see how it all plays out. Whenever they comes out lol…😏

Let me know your thoughts. And if you have evidences to disprove me, I’ll gladly hear them out, provided you’re polite and respectful when explaining them. 🙂

Lady Stoneheart and Arya Theory???

So I know a lot of people seem to think that Arya will end up in the Riverlands again so she can claim her pack (Nymeria & her little grey cousins) and so she can kill Lady Stoneheart, but I disagree. I don’t think Arya will end Lady Stoneheart, at least not in the Riverlands and not just after returning to Westeros. In fact, I don’t think she will run into the BWB while in the Riverlands. I think Arya will reclaim her relationship with Nymeria and possibly see some other old faces, but not the ones you would expect.

As for Lady Stoneheart, she will most likely make her way up North. Either because of the rumors about Arya, Stannis being up there in Winterfell & being a kin slayer(Undead!Cat is killing peeps she considers ‘no bueno’), Jon having gotten some sort of position of power in Winterfell (Catelyn wouldn’t be happy about that), cause she heard of Sansa being alive, or cause Thoros will convince her to head that way similar to the show (unlikely but a possibility). The Arya, Stannis, and Jon reasons are the most likely, in my opinion. I think she’ll already be headed North by the time Sansa heads there too. Plus, I don’t trust anything the show has to say so the Thoros one is less likely to me.

And while she’s up North, I think she’s going to have a very important role to play, which is the main reason I don’t think she will die in the Riverlands. What I mean pertains to the way she was brought back to life, the very literal 'Kiss of Life’. As far as we know being brought back isn’t something that widespread amongst the followers of the faith of the Lord of Light. If it was, more people would be converted and using it to try and bring their dead back. Furthermore, if Stoneheart was just meant to be a foil for the Frey’s & Brienne/ a stepping stone for Arya, then why give her such a unique way of being brought back? I’ll tell you why! It’s cause George is planning on using it later on. George has even stated that he thinks one of the double douches’ biggest mistakes is not bringing in Stoneheart (ie~ she’s vital to the story). Why say that if she’s just going to be killed by Arya??? No, she’s going to use the kiss to bring back someone else, who may or may not use it on someone else in return [possibly jon being brought back for a second time or the first( I only think this one because of how long cat had been dead when she was brought back vs beric & jon is at the wall where he won’t decompose any time soon) and then jon using this to bring back another maybe🤔(I have thoughts about this but I won’t get into that right now)]. Either way, George isn’t the type to introduce such a big game changer and then not use it.

Then there’s the whole Brienne plotline, which is currently tied to Stoneheart and the BWB the last time we read anything about them. Brienne is likely going to pass on some kind of info relevant to Stoneheart &/or be given a second chance with a new mission of sorts. I even think there’s a possibility of Brienne being brought back to life herself as an undead (I know how crackpotty this one is but wouldn’t it be cool 😉).

Anyways, I just think there’s too much that can be done with Stoneheart for her to die so simply at the hands of Arya so she may have some closure with her mother. If you ask me, Jon could do with a “talk” with Catelyn as well. In fact, all the remaining Stark children could.

Now, I’m not saying that it’s impossible that Arya will kill her mom in the Riverlands, I just don’t think it’s the most plausible outcome. Either way, we’ll just have to wait till TWOW is released to see how it all plays out. Whenever they comes out lol…😏

Let me know your thoughts. And if you have evidences to disprove me, I’ll gladly hear them out, provided you’re polite and respectful when explaining them. 🙂

blog.description:
Medical student in my 20s, fan of many things (primarily Tolkien and cute animal photos), known as seashadows on AO3 and Livejournal. I do not, in fact, hate this freaking cat.

Links can be found under the 'navigate' tab.

tags: a song of ice and fire
I was an Arya-esque semi-outcast for my autism with Sansa's sensibilities on things like getting dirty when I was a kid
I was bookish and loved making up stories with my dolls
but also liked to play outside and do pretend with my brothers
the sisters both have quirks that I love
like it's so adorable that Sansa says 'tummy'
and Arya holds grudges which is kind of cute in a 10-year-old
summary: Sign me up for the “I love both Sansa and Arya Stark, they’ve suffered too much, and I hope they develop a good relationship...
body:
Sign me up for the “I love both Sansa and Arya Stark, they’ve suffered too much, and I hope they develop a good relationship when they’re older and more mature (also please let them survive)” Club.

As long as there are cookies.

tags: i love them so so much
a song of ice and fire
summary: Jon's chapter: "And Arya . . . he missed her even more than Robb... Arya never seemed to fit, no more than he had . . . yet she...
body:
Jon’s chapter: “And Arya … he missed her even more than Robb… Arya never seemed to fit, no more than he had … yet she could always make Jon smile. He would give anything to be with her now, to muss up her hair once more and watch her make a face, to hear her finish a sentence with him.”

Arya’s chapter: “That was when Arya missed her brothers most. She wanted to tease Bran and play with baby Rickon and have Robb smile at her. She wanted Jon to muss up her hair and call her “little sister” and finish her sentences with her.”

Arya’s chapter: “That was when Arya missed her brothers most. She wanted to tease Bran and play with baby Rickon and have Robb smile at her. She wanted Jon to muss up her hair and call her “little sister” and finish her sentences with her.”

summary: As much as I am down for CleganebowI, I really want Arya to take down the Mountain. Like how poetic would that be? She deemed...
body: As much as I am down for CleganebowI, I really want Arya to take down the Mountain. Like how poetic would that be? She deemed both brothers worthy of her list but allows the younger more honorable man to live while destroying the monster. Ugh why is it not 2019? >_<

Arya: We agreed that‘s how we‘d raise our kids!

trail.content:
Arya: We agreed that‘s how we‘d raise our kids!

Gendry: Kids? Princess, we‘re not married.

Arya: Gendry, we‘re a little married.

Gendry: I know. I love it.

blog.name: she-wolf-of-highgarden
blog.title: They Danced Through The Day And Into The Night
blog.description: 23/grad student/book nerd/ lover of arya stark/ Meera Reed defender/ searching for Edric Dayne/ mainly Jonrya and Gendrya

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: All of the times Cat mentiones Arya
title: All of the times Cat mentiones Arya
body:
“He would always ask her that. “In the kitchen, arguing about names for the wolf pups.” She spread her cloak on the forest floor and sat beside the pool, her back to the weirwood. She could feel the eyes watching her, but she did her best to ignore them. “Arya is already in love, and Sansa is charmed and gracious, but Rickon is not quite sure.” - Cat I, AGoT

“Sansa would shine in the south, Catelyn thought to herself, and the gods knew that Arya needed refinement. Reluctantly, she let go of them in her heart. But not Bran. Never Bran. “Yes,” she said, “but please, Ned, for the love you bear me, let Bran remain here at Winterfell. He is only seven.” - Cat II, AGoT

“Also, if your sister Arya is returned to us safely, it is agreed that she will marry Lord Walder’s youngest son, Elmar, when the two of them come of age.” - Cat IX, AGoT

“She had not thought of that in years. How young they all had been—she no older than Sansa, Lysa younger than Arya, and Petyr younger still, yet eager. The girls had traded him between them, serious and giggling by turns.” - Cat IX, AGoT

“If your crown is the price we must pay to have Arya and Sansa returned safe, we should pay it willingly. Half your lords would like to murder Lannister in his cell. If he should die while he’s your prisoner, men will say—“ - Cat I, ACoK

“And your sisters?” Catelyn asked sharply. “Will they deserve their deaths as well? I promise you, if any harm comes to her brother, Cersei will pay us back blood for blood—” - Cat I, ACoK

“As she slept amidst the rolling grasslands, Catelyn dreamt that Bran was whole again, that Arya and Sansa held hands, that Rickon was still a babe at her breast. Robb, crownless, played with a wooden sword, and when all were safe asleep, she found Ned in her bed, smiling.” - Cat II, ACoK

“How they loved to promise heads, these men who would be king. “Your brother promised me the same. But if truth be told, I would sooner have my daughters back, and leave justice to the gods. Cersei still holds my Sansa, and of Arya there has been no word since the day of Robert’s death.” - Cat III, ACoK

“The statues in the great septs of the cities wore the faces the stonemasons had given them, but these charcoal scratchings were so crude they might be anyone. The Father’s face made her think of her own father, dying in his bed at Riverrun. The Warrior was Renly and Stannis, Robb and Robert, Jaime Lannister and Jon Snow. She even glimpsed Arya in those lines, just for an instant. Then a gust of wind through the door made the torch sputter, and the semblance was gone, washed away in orange glare.” - Cat IV, ACoK

“Lost and weary, Catelyn Stark gave herself over to her gods. She knelt before the Smith, who fixed things that were broken, and asked that he give her sweet Bran his protection. She went to the Maid and beseeched her to lend her courage to Arya and Sansa, to guard them in their innocence. To the Father, she prayed for justice, the strength to seek it and the wisdom to know it, and she asked the Warrior to keep Robb strong and shield him in his battles. Lastly she turned to the Crone, whose statues often showed her with a lamp in one hand.” - Cat IV, ACoK

“Those who favor Stannis will call it proof. Those who support Joffrey will say it means nothing.“ Her own children had more Tully about them than Stark. Arya was the only one to show much of Ned in her features. And Jon Snow, but he was never mine. She found herself thinking of Jon’s mother, that shadowy secret love her husband would never speak of. Does she grieve for Ned as I do? Or did she hate him for leaving her bed for mine? Does she pray for her son as I have prayed for mine?” - Cat VI, ACoK

“When he was done, Catelyn sat frowning. Edmure had been right, these were no terms at all, except … ”Lannister will exchange Arya and Sansa for his brother?“ - Cat VI, ACoK

“He told you true.” She could not even say that Robb was wrong. Arya and Sansa were children. The Kingslayer, alive and free, was as dangerous as any man in the realm. That road led nowhere. “Did you see my girls? Are they treated well?” Cat VI, ACoK

“Sansa, but not Arya. That might mean anything. Arya had always been harder to tame. Perhaps Cersei was reluctant to parade her in open court for fear of what she might say or do. They might have her locked safely out of sight. Or they might have killed her. Catelyn shoved the thought away. “His terms, you said … yet Cersei is Queen Regent.” - Cat VI, ACoK

“And Arya, well … Ned’s visitors would oft mistake her for a stableboy if they rode into the yard unannounced. Arya was a trial, it must be said. Half a boy and half a wolf pup. Forbid her anything and it became her heart’s desire. She had Ned’s long face, and brown hair that always looked as though a bird had been nesting in it. I despaired of ever making a lady of her. She collected scabs as other girls collect dolls, and would say anything that came into her head. I think she must be dead too.“ When she said that, it felt as though a giant hand were squeezing her chest. "I want them all dead, Brienne. Theon Greyjoy first, then Jaime Lannister and Cersei and the Imp, every one, every one. But my girls … my girls will …” - Cat VII, ACoK

“She will deliver Jaime to King’s Landing, and bring Arya and Sansa back to us safely.” - Cat I, ASos

“But now Robb was returned from the west, returned in triumph. He will forgive me, Catelyn told herself. He must forgive me, he is my own son, and Arya and Sansa are as much his blood as mine. He will free me from these rooms and then I will know what has happened.” - Cat II, ASoS

“He swore to trade her for his brother,“ she said numbly. ”Sansa and Arya both. We would have them back if we returned his precious Jaime, he swore it before the whole court. How could he marry her, after saying that in sight of gods and men?“ - Cat IV, ASoS

“She clutched tight at his hand. "Nothing will happen to you. Nothing. I could not stand it. They took Ned, and your sweet brothers. Sansa is married, Arya is lost, my father’s dead … if anything befell you, I would go mad, Robb. You are all I have left. You are all the north has left.” - Cat IV, ASoS

“So you pray. Have you considered your sisters? What of their rights? I agree that the north must not be permitted to pass to the Imp, but what of Arya? By law, she comes after Sansa … your own sister, trueborn …” - Cat V, ASoS

“All lost now, she reflected. Winterfell and Ned, Bran and Rickon, Sansa, Arya, all gone. Only Robb remains. Had there been too much of Lynesse Hightower in her after all, and too little of the Starks? Would that I had known how to wield an axe, perhaps I might have been able to protect them better.” - Cat V, ASoS

“It hurts so much, she thought. Our children, Ned, all our sweet babes. Rickon, Bran, Arya, Sansa, Robb … Robb … please, Ned, please, make it stop, make it stop hurting … The white tears and the red ones ran together until her face was torn and tattered, the face that Ned had loved. Catelyn Stark raised her hands and watched the blood run down her long fingers, over her wrists, beneath the sleeves of her gown. Slow red worms crawled along her arms and under her clothes. It tickles.” - Cat VII, ASoS

“It hurts so much, she thought. Our children, Ned, all our sweet babes. Rickon, Bran, Arya, Sansa, Robb … Robb … please, Ned, please, make it stop, make it stop hurting … The white tears and the red ones ran together until her face was torn and tattered, the face that Ned had loved. Catelyn Stark raised her hands and watched the blood run down her long fingers, over her wrists, beneath the sleeves of her gown. Slow red worms crawled along her arms and under her clothes. It tickles.” - Cat VII, ASoS
